meanings.sent1: After eating, I redigest my food to extract all the nutrients.
meanings.sent2: It is important for cows to redigest their food by chewing cud.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally redigest my lunch twice because I was so hungry!
meanings.sent4: She likes to redigest information slowly, like a cow chewing its cud.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked us to redigest the lesson to remember it better.

meanings.definition: To rework or revise a previously digested material.
meanings.sent1: I need to redigest my essay to improve its clarity.
meanings.sent2: The editor will redigest the manuscript before publishing it.
meanings.sent3: He had to redigest his speech after realizing he forgot an important point.
meanings.sent4: The artist redigests his sketches until they are perfect.
meanings.sent5: She redigests her notes to make sure she didn't miss any details.
